basics.name: Sergio Andrés Barbosa
basics.label: AI/ML Engineer
basics.summary: I am deeply passionate about intelligent systems, with a research focus at the intersection of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and human understanding. My goal is to create conversational agents that interact with people in a natural, human like manner. I have actively advanced the development of these systems by leveraging machine learning (ML) capabilities and specialized language models.

work.name: Digital GHENOVA, Spain
work.summary: Expertly developed innovative technological solutions based on language models for the creation of conversational agents for digital transformation, applied in areas such as healthcare and business.
highlights: AI generative techniques, NLP and finetuning Large Language Models(LLMs)
Designing conversational agents, applying DL and ML techniques

education.institution: The Naval School ’Almirante Padilla’, Cartagena, Colombia

awards.title: Cum Laude, Degree with honours in Master’s degree.
awards.summary: I graduated cum laude for my outstanding academic performance. This recognition was awarded during my studies in the Master’s Program in Artificial Intelligence.

awards.title: Meritorious thesis
awards.summary: Meritorious thesis, in computer vision achieved by implementing an AI model utilising Reinforcement.

awards.title: Medal “Francisco José de Caldas” category 'to consecration'
awards.summary: Awarded for having obtained the best grade-point average in the academic program of Electronic Engineering.

awards.title: Order of Naval Merit “Almirante Padilla” category “Officer”
awards.summary: For military virtues, dedication to work, distinguished professional services, exemplary discipline.

certificates.name: Machine Learning with Python-From Linear Models to Deep Learning

certificates.name: Microsoft Azure Databricks for Data Engineering
Database Design and Basic SQL in PostgreSQL

publications.name: Detection of Hate Speech, Racism and Misogyny in Digital Social Networks: Colombian
publications.summary: The main contribution of this work is the finetuning of a model using a proprietary dataset extracted from social networks, georeferenced in Colombia, and manually labelled with typical and dialect specific features. Indeed, the experiment compares the performance of TLM models adjusted to the Colombian slang domain against a GPT, having a significant impact on achieving more accurate predictions in this task.

publications.name: Identifying depressive language on Twitter with Word Embeddings and LDA
publications.summary: This study explores how mood manifests in text publications on Twitter, aiming to identify patterns indicative of depressive, anxious, and potentially suicidal language. This work involves training models using Word Embeddings methodology and applying Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) to group topics, comparing their performance with LLMs.

interests.name: AI/NLP
keywords: Intersection of AI and human understanding

projects.name: NER model
projects.summary: Successfully adapted and deployed a Named Entity Recognition (NER) model pretrained in the social context of victims and the armed conflict in Colombia, improving the accuracy and understanding of narratives surrounding this complex sociopolitical landscape.

projects.name: Center of Excellence in Big Data & Data Analytics
projects.summary: Successfully development of research project about text classification in the social context.
